summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Southwest Airlines, demanding passenger and other records for Ghislaine Maxwell and three other individuals (names redacted) for two time periods: 1994-1998 and July 2019 onward. The document includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing criminal investigation into violations including sex trafficking.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Listed as an individual for whom Southwest Airlines must produce all records, including passenger, payment, and membership data, for the periods 1994-1998 and July 2019 onward.

events.title: Grand Jury appearance date for Southwest Airlines
events.description: Southwest Airlines is commanded to appear before the Grand Jury in New York to testify and produce records, though personal appearance is waived if records are produced to the FBI by that date.

events.title: Issuance of grand jury subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a subpoena to Southwest Airlines as part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felonies including sex trafficking.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
Federal Bureau of Investigation, 26 Federal Plaza, VCAC/Human Trafficking, New York, NY 10278
Southwest Airlines Legal Department, P.O. Box 36611, Dallas, TX 75235
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena seeks Southwest Airlines records for Ghislaine Maxwell and three other individuals (names redacted in the provided text).

The requested time periods are January 1, 1994, through December 31, 1998, and July 1, 2019, through the date of service (January 2020), indicating investigative interest in both historical and recent travel.

The investigation concerns alleged violations of federal criminal law, specifically 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c) (conspiracy to commit sex trafficking), 2422(b) (coercion and enticement), and 371 (conspiracy).
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requests that Southwest Airlines not disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The document shows the ongoing nature of the federal grand jury investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell and associates as of January 2020.
